name: Contact Form 7 GetResponse Extension
author: Renzo Johnson

sections.description:
Integrate Contact Form 7 with GetResponse. Automatically add form submissions to predetermined lists in GetResponse, using its latest API. This GetResponse Extension supports multiple mailing lists and API Keys.

GetResponse Extension Support
Active support is not always provided for the Contact Form 7 GetResponse Extension on the WordPress.org forums. One-on-one email support is available to people who email the GetResponse Extension developer.

Bug Reports
Bug reports for the Contact Form 7 GetResponse Extension are welcome in the WordPress developers website.

Key Features

  • Easy to use
  • Use a different mailing list per contact form
  • Single opt-in – no confirmation email send to subscribers
  • Double opt-in – confirmation email send to subscribers
  • Opt-in checkbox – add the chance to opt-in/opt-out
  • Support for custom fields
  • Latest GetResponse API V3
  • Constantly updated

Requirements

  1. Self hosted WordPress.org installation (4.0 or higher)
  2. Contact Form 7 (4.2 or higher)
  3. GetResponse account
sections.installation:
1. Upload the entire ‘contact-form-7-mail-chimp-extension‘ folder to the ‘/wp-content/plugins/’ directory.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress.
  3. Once the plugin is active, you will see a new ‘tab’ inside Contact Form 7 admin interface.

You will find ‘GetResponse: Subscriber List Details‘ menu in your Contact Form 7 editor.

For basic usage, you can also have a look at the Contact Form 7 GetResponse Extension homepage, you can also have a look at the Contact Form 7 homepage.
sections.faq: Do you have questions or issues with Contact Form 7 GetResponse Extension? Use these support channels appropriately.

short_description: Simple way to integrate GetResponse mailing lists to Contact Form 7. Save your subscribers in a proper mailing list.
